data.name: root
data.value: Manages and tracks schema and data migrations in a database.

data.name: globaloptions.loglevel
data.value: The verbosity of logging output ([m]inimal, [n]ormal, or [d]etailed).

data.name: globaloptions.environmentfile
data.value: The path of the file tthat contains connection key/value pairs to include in the environment.

data.name: globaloptions.noterminal
data.value: Indicates the process does not have an interactive terminal. When specified, output formatting is disabled.

data.name: root version
data.value: Print the version of the current application.

data.name: connectionoptions.connectionstring
data.value: A composite connection string used by the database driver.

data.name: connectionoptions.host
data.value: The host of the database server.

data.name: connectionoptions.port
data.value: The port used in the database network connection.

data.name: connectionoptions.database
data.value: The target database to manage migrations in.

data.name: connectionoptions.userid
data.value: The user id used in the connection credential.

data.name: connectionoptions.password
data.value: The password used in the connection credential.

data.name: connectionoptions.properties
data.value: One or properties used by the database driver expressed as a key/value pair in the form KEY=VALUE.

data.name: newenvironmentoptions.outputfile
data.value: Path to the target file to write (required).

data.name: root env new-file
data.value: Creates a new environment file that contains connection properties.

data.name: newenvironmentoptions.edit
data.value: Launches an editor via the shell if one is configured with $DB4_EDITOR.

data.name: root env
data.value: Lists variables or creates environment files.

data.name: root env vars
data.value: Lists the environment variables the application supports.
